lines.text: Oh, Mr. Moto?
Yes, Lee?
I though you would like to know I got a letter from Pop yesterday.
Oh, you did?
Mm-hmm. He sent his best to you.
Thank you. And, uh, how is your honorable father enjoying his homelife in beautiful Honolulu?
He seems fine, but he kind of worries about me. Y'see, I'm really supposed to be studying art here at the university... but gosh, I want to be a detective!

[chuckles]
I understand. My parents wanted me to be an acrobat.
A sock in the eye ain't homicide. Maybe his ticker went bad on him. Who knows?
No one... except the coroner.
There is no situation that science and skill cannot master.
Oh, Scotty, if you'll turn me loose on this, I'll have this town so deep in tears that they'll be using canoes for taxicabs.
To recognize one's faults requires intelligence; to admit them requires courage.
Gosh, that's a pretty girl sitting with your friend!
That's his daughter Linda. She's got her nose so high in the air, she'd drown in a rainstorm.
Much information can be obtained from tongues loosened in anger.

[frustrated]
Medium height, medium build, medium complexion - I'd have to be a medium to find Howard from the description like that Detroit tailor gives me!

[arriving late and in a hurry]
We want two good seats down front!
Sorry, we're sold out.
He's sold out?
[to the ticket taker]
Do you know who we are?

[laconically, as he closes down the ticket window]
Sure, a couple of guys that ain't gonna see the fight.
Clipper, you'd suspect your own grandmother!
Yeah, but you're not my grandmother.
Don't bet on it!

[examining the dead body]
This is not suicide Mr. Riggs.
[dryly]
It's most unusual to shoot oneself in the back and without a gun.
Who pulled the strings to get this fight on tonight?
I plead guilty, Mr. Crowder. You see, some people save strings; I pull them.
